questions.question: 1. If size of the particle increases 2 times, then K ____.
2. For clay soils, soils with greater void ratios have ____ permeability.

explanations.a: In general, permeability increases with void ratio. But it is not applicable to all types of soils. For example, clay has a higher void ratio than any other types of soil but permeability for clays is very low. This is because the flow path through voids in case of clays is extremely small such that water cannot flow through this path easily.
explanations.b: In general, permeability increases with void ratio. But it is not applicable to all types of soils. For example, clay has a higher void ratio than any other types of soil but permeability for clays is very low.
explanations.c: There is a direct correlation between void ratio and permability and hence this cannot be the answer.
explanations.d: This is nearly impossible to achieve.

questions.question: 3. Due to change in temperature, the w and Î¼ of the liquid reduced by 10% and 40% respectively. What is the change in the permeability of the soil?
4. Permeable soil has a K (cm / sec) value of ____.

explanations.a: Greater the permeability value, the more permeable the soil will be.
explanations.b: A soil cannot be noticably permeable if it has a very small permeability value.
explanations.c: A soil cannot be permeable if it has a permeability value of 0.
explanations.d: One of the above answers accurately describes the relation.

questions.question: 5. Coefficient of permeability is also called as which of the following?

6. A constant head permeability test on a medium soil sample having a cross sectional area (A) of 7585 mm<sup>2</sup> yielded the following data: Distance between stand-pipes (L) = 100 mm, Constant head difference (h) = 70.4 mm, Quantity of water collected (Q) = 500 * 10<sup>3</sup> mm<sup>3</sup>, Time of collection (t) = 132 s. Determine the coefficient of permeability of the sand specimen.

explanations.a: This answer is probably obtained by application of an incorrect formula or a calculation error. The formula to be used is: Coefficient of permeability, k = Q * L / (A * t * h).
explanations.b: We obtain this answer by simply plugging in all the values in the formula: Coefficient of permeability, k = Q * L / (A * t * h).
explanations.c: This answer is probably obtained by application of an incorrect formula or a calculation error. The formula to be used is: Coefficient of permeability, k = Q * L / (A * t * h).
explanations.d: This answer is probably obtained by application of an incorrect formula or a calculation error. The formula to be used is: Coefficient of permeability, k = Q * L / (A * t * h).

questions.question: 7. In a falling head permeability test, a soil sample of 7585 mm<sup>2</sup> cross-section (A) and 210.2 mm length (L) was subjected to a flow of water from a stand-pipe having cross-sectional area (a) of 730 mm<sup>2</sup>. The stand-pipe level changed from 1650 mm (h<sub>1</sub>) to 550 mm (h<sub>2</sub>) above the reservoir datum during a time interval (t) of 182 sec. Determine the coefficient of permeability of the soil.

explanations.a: We obtain this answer by simply plugging in all the values in the formula: Coefficient of permeability, k = 2.303 * a * L * log (h<sub>1</sub> / h<sub>2</sub>) / (A * t).
explanations.b: This answer is probably obtained by application of an incorrect formula or a calculation error. The formula to be used is: Coefficient of permeability, k = 2.303 * a * L * log (h<sub>1</sub> / h<sub>2</sub>) / (A * t).
explanations.c: This answer is probably obtained by application of an incorrect formula or a calculation error. The formula to be used is: Coefficient of permeability, k = 2.303 * a * L * log (h<sub>1</sub> / h<sub>2</sub>) / (A * t).
explanations.d: This answer is probably obtained by application of an incorrect formula or a calculation error. The formula to be used is: Coefficient of permeability, k = 2.303 * a * L * log (h<sub>1</sub> / h<sub>2</sub>) / (A * t).
